su_6:
The Kupferstich-Kabinett museum provides digital images of the artwork 'Bauernhäuser am Berghang' by Caspar David Friedrich.
- Small and Medium Images: These images are freely accessible to everyone. No membership is required to view or download them.
- Original High-Resolution Image: Access to this image is restricted to members of the Kupferstich-Kabinett museum. Membership verification is required to obtain this high-resolution image.
su_7:
For 'Landschaft mit kahlem Baum' Artwork
To be presented in a virtual format, the following policy applies:
Event Format: The presentation of 'Landschaft mit kahlem Baum' will be conducted as a virtual event.
Geographic Limitation: Access to the virtual presentation is restricted to participants with verified IP addresses located within Germany.
No Copying: Participants are strictly prohibited from copying or distributing any digital content presented during the virtual event.
su_9:
The Kupferstich-Kabinett museum provides digital images of its artwork collection with the following usage limitations:
Viewing Limitations: Users are limited to viewing a maximum of 50 images per day. This ensures fair usage and availability of resources to all users.
High-Resolution Downloads: Downloading high-resolution images (greater than 300 dpi) requires a special request and an additional fee.
su_15: Accessing Copenhagen Botanical Institute's 'FloraNordica' endangered species database requires quarterly usage reports from subscribers (e.g., Nordic Environmental Agency). Crucially, this data cannot support patent applications for genetic materials.
su_16: Lisbon City Archives implements tiered access for its 'Century-Old Tram Photo Collection': Tourists view thumbnails freely; registered historical society members download medium-resolution images; publishers pay per-use fees for high-definition versions.
su_17: Real-time access to Brussels EU Documentation Centre's 'EurLexLive' policy API is reserved for member-state governments. Media outlets experience a 24-hour delay, while commercial entities may only query summaries and must visibly attribute the source.
su_19: Researchers examining Stockholm Nobel Archive's digitized laureate manuscripts may conduct full-text searches and quote excerpts (≤500 words). Full document replication demands written director approval and secure physical storage.
su_20: Ireland's 'SongChain' Folk Archive prioritizes contributors: Users uploading traditional melodies gain 72-hour early access to related new entries. General listeners hear only 30-second previews.
su_21: Prague Observatory provides its 'StarFeed' telescope data to research partners with a 6-month exclusive use right. During this period, dissemination to the public is prohibited. After the exclusivity period, the data is made available on a public channel, which distributes calibrated data with a 24-hour delay.
su_22: Commercial fashion designers using Zurich Textile Museum's high-definition 'Oriental Silk Pattern' scans pay 1.5% royalty fees on sales revenue. Cultural/educational usage is royalty-free.
su_28: Public health agencies may aggregate real-time ICU bed occupancy data from the Nordic Health Network. Publishing hospital-specific data violates policy, and access renews quarterly pending audit compliance.
su_29: Licensed pharmacies using the 'EU Drug Interaction API' must validate alerts against local formularies. Under no circumstances may raw API outputs be displayed to patients – only clinician-reviewed summaries.
su_37: City planners accessing 'Singapore Smart Grid Demand Forecasts' can incorporate projections into sustainability reports. Real-time operational decisions require written approval from EnergyMarket Regulator.
su_38: Construction firms using 'Berlin Bridge Sensor Feeds' for maintenance must share anomaly reports with the city within 24 hours. Raw data cannot be fused with third-party location datasets.
su_40: If air pollution exceeds WHO Stage 3, environmental researchers may redistribute 'Delhi Real-time AQI Data' without embargo. Under clean air conditions, a 48-hour publication delay applies.
su_66: The 'European Cultural Heritage Data Space' permits 'registered researchers' to access high-resolution scans of 'Renaissance Cartography Maps' for 'academic study', provided their institutional affiliation is verified, while low and medium-resolution previews are openly available to all users without registration.
su_67: Within the 'Digital Artifacts Exchange', 'licensed art historians' may download ultra-high-definition images of 'Ancient Greek Pottery' for 'curation projects' upon successful license validation, whereas standard and thumbnail images are accessible to the public without any authentication.
su_69: In the 'Global Museum Data Network', 'institutional partners' are authorized to obtain master-quality digital files of 'Impressionist Paintings' for 'exhibition planning' after confirming partnership status, but preview and medium-resolution images are available to all visitors without restrictions.
su_70: The 'Heritage Media Cloud' grants 'museum consortium members' permission to access archival-quality scans of 'Medieval Manuscripts' for 'digital restoration initiatives' upon membership validation, while low and medium-resolution copies remain openly accessible to the general public without login.

Scans at 300 dpi or below are freely available to all users for non-commercial purposes.

su_80: The 'Gaia-X Trusted Art Space' authorizes 'Museum Partners' to utilize 'Sculpture 3D Scans' for 'Virtual Exhibition Creation' when scan fidelity is above 300 dpi, requiring payment of a service fee. Scans at 300 dpi or lower are freely accessible for personal and educational use.

su_116: The 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone' enforces differentiated access to its 'Urban Air Quality Sensor Data': Environmental researchers may analyze aggregated datasets without restriction; certified municipal agencies can download detailed hourly readings; commercial analytics firms are charged per dataset for high-frequency raw sensor streams.
su_117: Within the 'European Health Data Space', access to the 'Multi-Year Clinical Trial Results' is stratified: Academic researchers may browse summary statistics openly; accredited medical institutions can retrieve anonymized patient-level data; pharmaceutical companies must pay per-use to obtain full trial datasets.

su_418: The 'European Digital Art Exchange' obliges generative AI platforms using 'Louvre Museum Open Collection Photos' to include 'Louvre Source' metadata in all resulting artworks. Any claim of original authorship or copyright ownership over these derivatives is forbidden.

su_426: Within the 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone', logistics companies utilizing 'Hamburg Port Crane Telemetry' for equipment monitoring are required to submit incident summaries to the port authority within 12 hours. Raw telemetry data must not be combined with external weather data sources.

cu_j_441: 在‘城市交通研究联盟’数据空间中，市政交通局（Municipal Transport Bureau）作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含实时公交车位置和乘客计数（匿名聚合）的数据集（CityBusData）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的学术研究成员非商业性研究使用数据，但必须在研究成果中注明数据来源。同时，市政交通局为特定的智慧城市项目合作伙伴制定了一个附加政策，授予他们在其城市交通优化平台商业性使用CityBusData的权限，条件是他们必须每季度向市政交通局提交使用报告并支付一定的数据许可费。此外，联盟政策严格禁止任何成员或第三方试图重新识别匿名乘客数据。
cu_j_442: 可信数据空间运营方应建立标准化的主体资质审核流程，包含申请受理、技术验证、信用评估环节。申请主体需通过统一入口提交资质证明文件及业务场景说明，运营方应在5个工作日内完成材料完整性初审。技术验证阶段需依托自动化检测工具对主体技术方案、安全能力及系统接口合规性开展评估，重点核查是否符合GB/T 37988三级认证要求及数据加密、访问控制等核心指标。信用评估环节应接入公共信用信息平台，核验主体历史经营异常记录、司法涉诉信息及行业信用评级，跨境主体需额外验证其数据出境合规备案文件。通过主体名单需公示3个工作日无异议后正式准入,全流程各环节应留存区块链存证记录，确保审核过程可追溯、不可篡改。
cu_j_443: 数据资源的接入审核需建立分类分级、质量评估、合规筛查三位一体的管控体系。依据《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》进行分类，类目包括一般数据、重要数据、核心数据，从数据敏感性（如个人数据、公共数据、行业数据）、应用场景（如科研、商业、政务）、风险等级（1-4级）三个维度进行标引。对3级以上（含）数据资源实施附加审查，包括数据血缘追溯、使用范围限定条款审查等。质量度量标准设定数据完整性（≥98%）、字段填充率（≥95%）、时效性（实时数据延迟≤1秒）等量化指标，接入时要求数据提供方需通过质量检测工具生成并提供评估报告。数据资源的接入审核应建立数据来源合规性审查机制，重点验证数据采集的合法性及授权完整性。
cu_j_444: 对于权属不清或合规性存疑的数据，可通过仲裁进行解决。运营协议中应当明确约定仲裁机构，仲裁过程需遵循以下规则：争议方需在3个工作日内提交完整证据链，包括数据采集授权书、处理记录等；仲裁结果通过智能合约自动执行，如判定数据违规则触发链上销毁指令；涉及国家安全的争议数据，应立即上报省级以上网信部门并冻结相关账户。
cu_j_445: 可信数据空间需通过标准化接口实现数据发布、查询、交付全流程贯通。接口规范方面：数据目录查询接口需支持跨空间联合检索功能，返回结果应包含数据可用性状态如“直接调用”“需授权申请”；数据交付接口应兼容主流传输协议，支持分片加密与动态路由寻址，确保高敏感数据采用“可用不可见”模式交付。数据交互流程包括：发布阶段，数据提供方需通过加密通道上传数据资源，并同步生成包含哈希值、数字签名的完整性凭证；查询阶段，用户可对空间内资源进行检索，检索结果需返回数据可用性状态如“可调用”“需授权申请”，并自动过滤未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付应按规定采取加密传输技术，3级及以上敏感数据需通过可信执行环境（TEE）或隐私计算框架实现价值释放，禁止明文传输。
cu_j_446: 接入主体的资质与数据资源合规性需实施周期性重审。对技术服务商每12个月进行一次数据安全能力复评，复评未达标的给予90天整改期，逾期未通过者将被移出服务商名录，并对数据产品和服务提供商实施动态审查；对已接入的数据资源每6个月进行质量抽检，若抽检不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全量审查；当数据相关法律法规或可信数据空间相关国家标准发生修订或新出台时，应在30个工作日内更新审核规则，并通知所有参与方，督促其在整改期限内或新规定生效前完成合规调整。
cu_j_447: 数据使用过程需通过“日志存证-零知识验证-异常熔断”实现全生命周期可追溯。日志管理方面，应记录数据调用、计算、传输、销毁全环节日志，关键操作如敏感字段访问、跨境传输需附加零知识证明（ZKP）存证，证明内容经哈希处理后锚定至区块链，原始日志保留期限不得少于5年。隐私增强技术要求个人敏感信息处理采用同态加密、联邦学习等技术实现“数据可用不可见”，统计类数据共享应满足差分隐私（ε≤1.5）要求，数据服务方负责技术方案合规性验证，并向运营方提交第三方检测报告。异常熔断机制规定当单日异常访问量超过阈值（建议设定为日均访问量150%）时，自动触发三级熔断响应：一级熔断暂停可疑账户访问权限，二级熔断隔离受影响数据资源，三级熔断启动全空间安全巡检。熔断状态解除需满足双重条件：运营方完成根本原因分析报告且使用方重新通过安全认证。

cu_j_451: Registered non-commercial drone operators are permitted to download the 'Alpine Geohazard Maps' from SwissTopo for flight planning, although access to the raw data files expires after 72 hours. While using the maps, they have an obligation to credit SwissTopo as the data source in their flight logs and are strictly prohibited from redistributing the original map files to third parties. For commercial companies seeking to integrate the data into proprietary software, access is granted upon payment of a per-square-kilometer fee.
cu_j_452: Access to the 'Tokyo Crowd Movement Cameras' is tiered based on a user's choice regarding facial analysis. Users who consent to the analysis are granted prioritized, real-time camera feeds. Those who choose to opt-out are instead provided with access to an anonymized version of the same feeds. As an overriding privacy safeguard that applies to all users, the system is strictly prohibited from creating or storing any biometric profiles from the data, regardless of an individual's consent decision.
cu_j_453: The data analytics provider QuantAnalytics must pay a per-call base fee to access LogiCore's freight data, LC-Freight-Flow-Data. Its derivative data product, UAI-Index, may only be queried via the platform's certified API, with any form of batch download or redistribution strictly prohibited. All subscription revenue from this product is automatically distributed after each transaction by a smart contract: LogiCore receives 35% as a data royalty, and QuantAnalytics retains 65%. The distribution record will be logged on-chain for evidence.
cu_j_454: To access EARC's driving dataset EU-Driving-V2X, AIAI Lab must first submit a cross-border data security compliance certificate from its home country. Before export, the data must undergo secondary anonymization in EARC's Trusted Execution Environment (TEE). The data may only be used for model training within a pre-certified Trusted Research Environment (TRE) and is strictly forbidden from leaving the TRE in its raw form; only trained models that do not contain source data may be exported. Access is granted exclusively to researchers jointly reviewed and registered by both parties, and all their activity logs must be transmitted in real-time back to EARC's monitoring node.
cu_j_455: Any data space participant who discovers a data quality issue must report it within 15 minutes. The system will automatically flag the data as 'Under Review' and suspend its service calls. The data provider must submit a root-cause analysis within 6 hours and complete the fix, which must pass automated verification, within 24 hours, or their data publishing rights will be suspended. If the same provider has more than three such incidents within a 90-day period, they will be placed on a watchlist for stricter review. After the issue is resolved, the system will automatically send a correction notice to all users who called the data in the past 48 hours.
cu_j_456: Before using government data to train the AI model, research institutions must submit an 'algorithm impact assessment report' and ensure that the fairness index of the model before deployment is lower than 0.05. The trained model must test its bias and robustness through a neutral third-party sandbox. After passing the test, its evaluation summary, design purpose and data usage list need to be publicized on the public portal. After the model is deployed, the operator retains the right to conduct persistent bias monitoring. If it is found that its performance harms the public interest, its deployment license can be revoked.
cu_j_457: The ocean temperature dataset Oceans-2024, published by the climate research organization OpenClimate, adopts a derivative license based on 'Attribution-ShareAlike' (CC BY-SA). Any user may modify the data and create derivative works, provided that they prominently attribute the data source via its Digital Object Identifier (DOI) in their usage reports and the metadata of any derivatives. All derivative data products created from this data must also be released under an equivalent CC BY-SA license. While academic users are granted free access to the original data, commercial entities must pay an operational cost fee for its use.
cu_j_458: The rare disease imaging dataset RareMed-Image, shared by a hospital consortium, is governed by enhanced rules based on the 'Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives' (CC BY-NC-ND) principle. The data is licensed exclusively for non-commercial research and any form of modificationis prohibited. Researchers must obtain prior approval from an ethics committee before use and explicitly acknowledge the data source in any resulting publications. Pharmaceutical companies applying for access must sign a supplemental agreement prohibiting the use of the data for AI model training and pay a maintenance fee at twice the standard rate.
cu_j_459: The real-time traffic data TrafficLive-2025, released by the Ministry of Transport, is licensed under 'Attribution' (CC BY 4.0), permitting maximum freedom of use and redistribution. Users must adhere to two dynamic obligations: a quarterly report on usage effectiveness must be submitted; and if a commercial, fee-based service is developed using this data, 1% of its annual revenue must be contributed to a designated public data maintenance fund. In the event of a service disruption exceeding two hours, all currently active users are obligated to assist by submitting incident impact logs.
cu_j_460: The traditional crafts video library CraftHeritage-SA, published by an intangible cultural heritage center, adopts a preservation and inheritance mechanism based on 'Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike' (CC BY-NC-SA). It permits non-commercial adaptation and remixing, but all derivative works must be re-released under an equivalent CC BY-NC-SA license. When publishing a derivative work, the user must log its hash value onto a designated cultural heritage blockchain and prominently display the original material's unique identifier in the work's description. An annual commercial license must be purchased separately for the use of any materials or derivatives in commercial exhibitions or events.
cu_j_461: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，省级卫生信息中心作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含临床试验结果和患者统计（匿名汇总）的数据集（ClinicalTrialStats）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的医疗研究机构成员仅用于非商业性医学研究，且研究成果中必须注明数据来源。同时，卫生信息中心为特定的医疗器械企业合作伙伴制定了附加政策，允许其在医疗设备性能分析平台上商业性使用ClinicalTrialStats，前提是每半年向卫生信息中心提交使用报告并支付数据许可费用。此外，联盟政策严禁任何成员或第三方尝试还原匿名患者身份信息。
cu_j_462: 在“能源物联网数据空间”中，国家电网公司作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含实时用电负荷和设备运行状态（匿名聚合）的数据集（GridUsageData）。该数据集根据联盟基础政策，允许联盟内的高校能源研究团队仅用于学术研究目的，且发表成果时需注明数据来源。同时，国家电网公司为特定的智能电网解决方案供应商设立了补充政策，允许其在能源调度优化平台上商业使用GridUsageData，条件是每季度向国家电网公司提交详细使用报告并支付许可费用。联盟政策明确禁止任何成员或第三方试图识别单一用户的用电信息。
cu_j_463: 在“农业数据协作空间”中，省农业科技中心作为数据提供者，发布了包含农作物生长监测和产量统计（匿名化）的数据集（AgriGrowthData）。该数据集依据联盟基础政策，允许联盟内的农业科研机构成员仅限非营利性科研使用，且成果中需注明数据来源。同时，农业科技中心为特定的农业科技企业合作伙伴制定了额外政策，允许其在智能农场管理系统中商业性利用AgriGrowthData，前提是每季度向农业科技中心提交使用报告并缴纳数据许可费用。联盟政策严格禁止任何成员或第三方尝试还原农户身份信息。
cu_j_464: 在“智慧物流数据空间”中，区域物流协会作为数据提供者，发布了包含货运车辆轨迹和装载量（匿名汇总）的数据集（LogiFleetData）。该数据集遵循联盟基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的高校物流研究团队仅限于非商业性学术研究，且研究成果需注明数据来源。同时，物流协会为特定的物流平台企业合作伙伴设定了附加政策，允许其在运输调度优化平台上商业性使用LogiFleetData，条件是每季度向物流协会提交使用报告并支付许可费用。联盟政策严禁任何成员或第三方试图还原单一货运车辆或司机身份。
cu_j_465: 在“绿色建筑数据空间”中，市建筑节能中心作为数据提供者，发布了包含建筑能耗和设备运行（匿名化）的数据集（GreenBuildingData）。该数据集依据联盟基础政策，允许联盟内的建筑设计院成员仅限于非商业性节能研究，且成果中需注明数据来源。同时，建筑节能中心为特定的节能技术企业合作伙伴制定了补充政策，允许其在建筑能效评估平台上商业性使用GreenBuildingData，前提是每季度向建筑节能中心提交使用报告并支付数据许可费用。联盟政策严格禁止任何成员或第三方尝试还原单一建筑或住户的身份信息。
cu_j_466: 智慧医疗数据空间管理方须制定统一的机构准入审核机制，涵盖申请受理、技术能力验证及合规信用评估。申请机构需通过官方门户提交资质材料及医疗数据应用场景说明，管理方应在3个工作日内完成材料完整性初审。技术验证阶段需利用自动化工具对机构的系统安全性、数据处理能力及接口标准进行合规检测，重点检查是否符合《电子健康档案安全规范》二级认证及数据加密、访问权限等关键要求。信用评估环节应对接国家医疗信用信息平台，核查机构历史违规记录、法律诉讼及行业信用等级，涉外机构需额外核验其数据跨境合规备案。审核通过名单需公示2个工作日无异议后方可正式接入，整个流程各环节应通过区块链技术留存不可篡改的审查凭证，确保全程可追溯。
cu_j_467: 绿色能源数据联盟运营方应建立标准化成员资质审核流程，包括申请受理、技术合规性验证和信用评估。申请成员需通过联盟统一平台提交资质证明及绿色能源应用场景说明，运营方应在7个工作日内完成材料初步审核。技术合规性验证需借助自动化检测系统，对成员的能源数据采集方案、信息安全措施及接口协议进行评估，重点核查是否满足ISO 27001安全标准及数据加密、访问控制等核心要求。信用评估环节需接入国家企业信用信息公示系统，核查成员历史经营异常、法律诉讼及行业信用等级，跨境成员需额外提交数据出境合规证明。通过名单需公示5个工作日无异议后方可正式加入，审核各环节应利用区块链存证，确保流程透明且不可篡改。
cu_j_468: 智慧物流数据空间管理机构应设立统一的企业资质审核流程，涵盖申请受理、技术能力验证和信用评估。申请企业需通过数据空间门户提交资质文件及物流数据应用场景说明，管理机构应在4个工作日内完成材料完整性初审。技术能力验证阶段需依托自动化检测工具，对企业的物流数据处理系统、安全防护能力及接口标准进行合规性评估，重点核查是否符合《物流信息安全规范》二级认证及数据加密、访问控制等要求。信用评估环节应接入全国企业信用信息平台，核查企业历史经营异常、司法诉讼及行业信用评级，跨境企业需额外核验其数据跨境合规备案。审核通过名单需公示3个工作日无异议后正式准入，审核流程各环节应通过区块链技术留存不可篡改的记录，保障全程可追溯。
cu_j_469: 工业互联网数据空间运营方需建立标准化的供应商资质审核机制，流程包括申请受理、技术方案验证及信用评估。供应商需通过统一入口提交资质证明和工业数据应用场景说明，运营方应在5个工作日内完成材料初审。技术方案验证阶段需借助自动化检测平台，对供应商的系统架构、安全能力及接口合规性进行评估，重点核查是否符合《工业信息安全标准》三级认证及数据加密、访问控制等核心指标。信用评估环节应对接国家企业信用信息系统，核查供应商历史经营异常、司法涉诉及行业信用等级，涉外供应商需额外提交数据出境合规备案。通过名单需公示3个工作日无异议后正式接入，审核流程各环节应利用区块链存证，确保过程可追溯且不可篡改。
cu_j_470: 智慧农业数据空间管理方应制定统一的合作方资质审核流程，包含申请受理、技术能力验证及信用评估。合作方需通过官方平台提交资质证明及农业数据应用场景说明，管理方应在2个工作日内完成材料完整性初审。技术能力验证阶段需依托自动化检测工具，对合作方的数据采集系统、安全防护能力及接口标准进行合规性评估，重点核查是否符合《农业数据安全规范》二级认证及数据加密、访问控制等要求。信用评估环节应接入全国企业信用信息平台，核查合作方历史经营异常、司法诉讼及行业信用评级，跨境合作方需额外核验其数据跨境合规备案。通过名单需公示1个工作日无异议后正式准入，审核流程各环节应通过区块链技术留存不可篡改的记录，确保全流程可追溯。
cu_j_471: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，要求“医院数据提供方”在接入“临床试验结果”时，必须建立基于《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》的分级分类、质量评估与合规筛查三重审核体系。数据需按一般、重要、核心类别，并结合敏感性（如患者隐私、公共健康、科研数据）、应用场景（医学研究、政策制定、医疗服务）、风险等级（1-4级）进行标注。对于3级及以上数据，需额外进行数据溯源和用途范围条款审查。质量标准包括数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性≤1秒，接入时需提交由质量检测工具生成的评估报告。同时，必须对数据采集合法性和授权完整性进行合规性核查。
cu_j_472: 在“能源数据互联平台”中，规定“电力公司”在接入“分布式能源消耗数据”时，必须遵循《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》进行数据分类分级，并建立质量评估和合规筛查机制。数据需按一般、重要、核心类别，结合数据敏感性（如用户用电信息、企业能耗、行业统计）、应用场景（能效分析、市场预测、政策监管）、风险等级（1-4级）进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行血缘追溯和用途限制条款审核。质量要求为完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、数据延迟≤1秒，接入时需提交质量检测工具生成的报告。还需重点审查数据采集的合法性及授权文件的完整性。
cu_j_473: 在“智慧农业数据联盟”中，要求“农企数据提供者”在接入“作物生长监测数据”时，必须建立分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查三位一体的审核体系，依据《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》进行分类，涵盖一般、重要、核心数据。需从数据敏感性（如农户隐私、气象数据、行业数据）、应用场景（精准农业、科研、政策制定）、风险等级（1-4级）三方面进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行数据血缘追溯和用途范围条款审查。质量标准包括数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性≤1秒，接入时须提交由检测工具生成的质量评估报告，并对数据采集合法性和授权完整性进行合规性审查。
cu_j_474: 在“智慧城市数据空间”内，规定“城市基础设施运营商”在接入“实时交通流量数据”时，必须建立基于《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》的分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查体系。数据需按一般、重要、核心类别，结合敏感性（如个人出行、公共交通、行业数据）、应用场景（交通管理、城市规划、商业分析）、风险等级（1-4级）进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行数据血缘追溯和用途限定条款审查。质量要求为数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性≤1秒，接入时需由质量检测工具生成评估报告，并对数据采集的合法性及授权完整性进行重点合规性审核。
cu_j_475: 在“工业互联网数据空间”中，要求“智能制造企业”在接入“设备运行日志数据”时，必须建立分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查三重管控体系，依据《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》进行分类，包括一般、重要、核心数据。需从数据敏感性（如企业机密、生产参数、行业数据）、应用场景（设备预测性维护、生产优化、合规审计）、风险等级（1-4级）三方面进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行数据血缘追溯和用途范围条款审查。质量标准为数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性≤1秒，接入时需提交质量检测工具生成的评估报告，并对数据采集的合法性和授权完整性进行合规性审查。
cu_j_476: 在“医疗数据互联空间”中，若数据归属存在争议或合规性不明确，参与方可通过指定仲裁机构解决。运营协议须明确仲裁方，仲裁流程要求争议双方于2个工作日内提交所有相关证明材料（如数据采集同意书、处理日志等）；仲裁裁决将由区块链智能合约自动执行，若数据被判违规则立即触发链上数据销毁；如争议涉及公共卫生安全，须第一时间上报国家卫健委并冻结相关数据访问权限。
cu_j_477: 在“能源数据共享联盟”内，针对权属或合规性有疑问的数据，允许通过第三方仲裁机构裁决。联盟协议需指明仲裁机构，仲裁流程要求各方在5个工作日内提交完整的授权与处理凭证；仲裁结果通过智能合约自动落实，若认定数据违规则自动执行数据删除；如争议数据涉及国家能源安全，须立即报告国家能源局并暂停相关数据账户。
cu_j_478: 在“智慧城市数据空间”中，若数据归属或合规性存在异议，争议方可依照协议约定的仲裁机构进行仲裁。协议需明确仲裁流程，要求各方于3个工作日内提交数据授权证明、处理记录等证据；仲裁结果由智能合约自动执行，若数据被判违规则立即触发数据销毁流程；如涉及城市安全，需即时上报市级网信部门并冻结相关数据流转。
cu_j_479: 在“工业互联网数据联盟”内，针对归属不明或合规性存疑的数据，允许通过联盟指定仲裁机构裁决。联盟协议须明确仲裁流程，争议方需在2个工作日内提交数据采集授权、处理记录等完整证据；仲裁结果通过链上智能合约自动执行，若数据被判违规则立即销毁；如争议涉及国家工业安全，须立即上报工信部并冻结相关账户。
cu_j_480: 在“金融数据交换平台”中，若数据权属或合规性存在争议，参与机构可通过协议指定的仲裁机构进行裁决。协议应明确仲裁流程，要求争议方在4个工作日内提交全部授权及处理记录等证据链；仲裁结果由智能合约自动执行，若数据被判违规则自动触发数据销毁；如争议数据涉及金融安全，须立即上报央行并冻结相关账户。
cu_j_481: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，要求所有成员机构通过统一API实现医疗数据的注册、检索与交付全流程互通。接口标准：数据目录检索接口需支持跨医院联合查询，并返回数据可用性状态（如“可直接访问”“需伦理审批”）；数据交付接口应兼容HL7 FHIR等主流协议，支持分段加密及动态寻址，确保高敏感健康数据采用“可用不可见”模式交付。数据交互流程包括：发布阶段，数据提供方需通过加密通道上传数据并生成带有哈希与数字签名的完整性凭证；检索阶段，用户可检索空间内资源，结果需返回可用性状态并自动屏蔽未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需采用加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过隐私计算平台或可信执行环境（TEE）实现价值释放，严禁明文传输。
cu_j_482: 在“能源物联网数据空间”中，电力公司与设备制造商必须通过标准化接口完成能耗数据的发布、查询和交付。接口要求：目录查询接口需支持跨企业联合检索，返回数据可用性（如“可实时获取”“需审批”）；交付接口应兼容MQTT等主流协议，支持分片加密与动态路由，确保高敏感能耗数据以“可用不可见”方式交付。流程包括：发布时，数据方通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希及数字签名凭证；查询时，用户可检索资源，结果需显示可用性并自动过滤未授权数据；交付时，数据需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过TEE或隐私计算框架处理，禁止明文交付。
cu_j_483: 在“智慧农业数据空间”中，农企与科研机构须通过统一接口实现作物生长数据的发布、检索与交付。接口规范：目录检索接口需支持跨区域联合查询，返回数据可用性（如“可直接下载”“需合作协议”）；交付接口应兼容RESTful等主流协议，支持分片加密和动态寻址，确保高敏感农情数据以“可用不可见”模式交付。流程包括：发布阶段，数据方通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希与数字签名凭证；检索阶段，用户可检索资源，结果需返回可用性并自动屏蔽未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过TEE或隐私计算框架实现价值释放，严禁明文传输。
cu_j_484: 在“智慧城市交通数据空间”中，交通管理局与出行服务商需通过标准化接口贯通交通流量数据的发布、检索和交付。接口要求：目录查询接口需支持跨部门联合检索，返回数据可用性（如“可直接调用”“需审批”）；交付接口应兼容HTTPS等主流协议，支持分片加密与动态寻址，确保高敏感交通数据以“可用不可见”模式交付。流程包括：发布阶段，数据方通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希及数字签名凭证；检索阶段，用户可检索资源，结果需返回可用性并自动过滤未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过TEE或隐私计算框架实现价值释放，禁止明文传输。
cu_j_485: 在“工业制造数据空间”中，设备供应商与工厂运营商须通过标准化接口实现设备运行数据的全流程发布、查询与交付。接口规范：目录检索接口需支持跨工厂联合检索，返回数据可用性（如“可直接集成”“需授权”）；交付接口应兼容OPC UA等主流协议，支持分片加密和动态寻址，确保高敏感设备数据以“可用不可见”模式交付。流程包括：发布阶段，数据方通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希与数字签名凭证；检索阶段，用户可检索资源，结果需返回可用性并自动屏蔽未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过TEE或隐私计算框架实现价值释放，严禁明文传输。
cu_j_486: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，要求所有健康数据服务商每12个月接受一次数据隐私与安全能力复核，若复核未达标，给予90天整改期，逾期未合格者将被暂停数据访问权限，并对医疗数据产品供应商实施持续合规监控；所有已接入的临床试验结果数据每6个月进行质量抽检，若抽检不合格率高于5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面审核；当医疗数据相关法律法规或国家标准发生更新或出台新规时，须在30个工作日内修订审核流程并通知所有成员，确保其在整改期或新规生效前完成合规调整。
cu_j_487: 在“能源物联网数据联盟”中，规定所有能源管理平台运营商每12个月必须接受一次信息安全能力复核，未通过者有90天整改期，整改后仍不合格将被移除联盟白名单，并对数据产品及服务提供商实施动态合规检查；所有已接入的电网运行数据每6个月进行一次质量抽查，若不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面复核；当能源数据相关法律或联盟标准修订或新增时，须在30个工作日内更新审核标准并通知所有成员，要求其在规定期限内完成合规整改。
cu_j_488: 在“智慧农业数据空间”中，所有农业技术服务商需每12个月接受一次数据安全与合规能力复审，未达标者有90天整改期，逾期仍不合格将被移出服务商列表，并对农业数据产品和服务提供商实施动态合规监督；所有已接入的作物生长监测数据每6个月进行质量抽检，若抽检不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全量数据进行审核；如遇农业数据相关法律法规或国家标准调整，须在30个工作日内修订审核规范并通知所有参与方，要求其在整改期或新规生效前完成合规调整。
cu_j_489: 在“智慧城市数据空间”中，所有城市基础设施数据服务商需每12个月进行一次数据安全能力复评，未通过者给予90天整改期，整改后仍不合格将被移出服务商名录，并对数据产品及服务提供商实施动态合规检查；所有已接入的城市交通流量数据每6个月进行质量抽检，若抽检不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面审核；当城市数据相关法律法规或国家标准修订或新颁布时，须在30个工作日内更新审核规则并通知所有成员，要求其在整改期限内或新规生效前完成合规调整。
cu_j_490: 在“工业互联网数据空间”中，所有设备制造商每12个月需接受一次数据安全与合规能力复核，未达标者有90天整改期，逾期未合格将被移除合作名单，并对数据产品和服务提供商实施动态合规审查；所有已接入的设备运行状态数据每6个月进行质量抽检，若抽检不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面审核；如遇工业数据相关法律法规或国家标准更新，应在30个工作日内修订审核流程并通知所有参与方，督促其在整改期限内或新规生效前完成合规整改。
cu_j_491: 在“智慧医疗数据联盟”中，要求所有数据使用活动通过“日志存证-多方安全计算-异常熔断”机制实现全流程可追溯。日志管理需覆盖数据查询、分析、传输及销毁环节，涉及敏感诊疗数据访问或跨境共享时，必须附加多方安全计算（MPC）证明，相关证明经哈希后锚定至联盟区块链，原始日志保存时间不得少于6年。个人健康信息处理应采用同态加密与联邦学习等隐私增强技术，确保“数据可用不可见”；统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.0）标准。数据服务提供方需对技术方案合规性负责，并向联盟管理方提交第三方合规检测报告。异常熔断机制规定，若单日异常访问量超过日均120%，则自动分三级响应：一级暂停相关账户，二级隔离受影响数据，三级启动联盟全域安全巡检。解除熔断需同时满足管理方完成根因分析及服务方重新通过安全认证。
cu_j_492: 在“能源物联网数据空间”内，所有数据操作需通过“日志存证-同态加密验证-异常熔断”保障全生命周期可追溯。日志必须涵盖数据采集、处理、传输与销毁全过程，关键操作如用户用能数据访问或数据出境时，需附加同态加密证明，证明内容哈希后锚定至能源联盟区块链，原始日志保存期限不少于4年。个人用能信息处理应采用联邦学习等隐私增强技术，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤2.0）要求。数据服务商负责技术合规性验证，并向平台运营方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均130%，自动触发三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全网安全检查。熔断解除需运营方完成原因分析并由服务商重新通过安全认证。
cu_j_493: 在“智慧物流数据协作区”中，所有数据使用活动必须通过“日志存证-可信执行环境验证-异常熔断”实现全流程可追溯。日志需覆盖数据调度、处理、传输及销毁环节，涉及敏感运输路径或国际数据流动时，需附加可信执行环境（TEE）证明，证明经哈希后锚定至区块链，原始日志保存期不得少于3年。个人位置信息处理应采用同态加密与联邦学习等隐私增强技术，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.2）标准。数据服务方负责合规性验证，并向运营管理方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均访问量140%，自动分三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全域安全巡检。解除熔断需管理方完成根因分析且服务方重新通过安全认证。
cu_j_494: 在“金融数据互联空间”中，所有数据操作需通过“日志存证-零知识证明-异常熔断”机制保障全生命周期可追溯。日志管理应覆盖数据查询、分析、传输及销毁全流程，涉及敏感金融字段访问或跨境传输时，需附加零知识证明（ZKP）存证，证明内容哈希后锚定至金融联盟区块链，原始日志保存期不得少于7年。个人金融信息处理应采用同态加密与联邦学习等隐私增强技术，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.3）要求。数据服务提供方需负责技术合规性验证，并向联盟运营方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均访问量125%，自动分三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全域安全巡检。解除熔断需联盟方完成根因分析且服务方重新通过安全认证。
cu_j_495: 在“智慧农业数据合作区”内，所有数据使用活动需通过“日志存证-多方计算验证-异常熔断”实现全生命周期可追溯。日志管理应覆盖数据采集、处理、传输及销毁各环节，涉及敏感农田地块数据访问或数据跨境流动时，需附加多方计算（MPC）证明，证明内容哈希后锚定至农业联盟区块链，原始日志保存期不得少于5年。个人农户信息处理应采用同态加密与联邦学习等隐私增强技术，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.1）要求。数据服务方负责技术合规性验证，并向运营管理方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均访问量135%，自动分三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全域安全巡检。解除熔断需管理方完成根因分析且服务方重新通过安全认证。
cu_j_496: In the 'Healthcare Research Data Space', only individuals who are at least 16 years old, or meet the minimum age of consent in their jurisdiction, are permitted to register and access 'Clinical Trial Data Services'. Users under 21 must obtain explicit consent from a parent or legal guardian before using the Services. Accurate and complete registration details are required, and account credentials must not be shared or transferred. If registering or accessing the Services on behalf of an organization, the user must have the authority to agree to the Data Space Terms for that entity.
cu_j_497: Within the 'Smart Energy Consortium', participants must be at least 18 years old, or the legal minimum age in their region, to register and access 'Grid Usage Analytics'. Those under 21 require parental or guardian approval. Registration mandates truthful and comprehensive information, and sharing of account credentials is strictly prohibited; users are accountable for all actions under their account. When acting on behalf of a company, the registrant must possess authorization to accept the Consortium's terms for that company.
cu_j_498: The 'Agri-Food Data Exchange' requires that users be no younger than 15 years old, or the minimum age of digital consent in their country, to create an account and access 'Crop Yield Forecasting Services'. Users below 18 must secure parental or guardian permission. Registration information must be accurate and complete, and accounts are personal—credentials may not be disclosed or used by others. Users registering or accessing on behalf of another party must have the legal authority to bind that party to the Exchange's terms.

cu_j_501: If you believe your proprietary manufacturing process data has been misused within the 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone', please submit a formal complaint to the designated compliance office or complete the online incident report. Commercial use of these guides or their adaptations in paid training programs or agri-business expos requires an annual commercial license.
cu_j_560: The 'Open Medical Imaging Dataset', provided by the International Radiology Alliance, is distributed under an 'Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike' (CC BY-NC-SA) license. Medical researchers are permitted to preprocess and combine images for non-commercial research, with the obligation that all resulting datasets are shared under the same CC BY-NC-SA license. When a new dataset is published, its hash must be recorded on the medical data blockchain, and the original dataset's unique identifier must be included in the dataset's metadata. Any commercial application of these images or their derivatives in diagnostic software or commercial studies necessitates the purchase of an annual commercial license.
cu_j_561: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，区域医疗中心作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含临床试验结果和患者统计（匿名聚合）的数据集（ClinicalTrialStats）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的生物医药研究机构成员仅限非盈利性科研使用，但须在相关论文中注明数据来源。同时，区域医疗中心为特定的医疗AI开发企业制定了附加政策，允许其在AI诊断模型训练平台上商业性使用ClinicalTrialStats，条件是每半年向区域医疗中心提交详细使用报告并支付数据授权费用。此外，联盟政策严禁任何成员或第三方尝试还原匿名患者身份信息。
cu_j_562: 在“能源物联网数据空间”中，国家电力调度中心作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含分布式电网实时负荷和用电模式（匿名聚合）的数据集（GridLoadData）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的高校能源研究团队仅用于学术研究目的，且须在研究报告中注明数据来源。同时，国家电力调度中心为特定的智能电网解决方案供应商制定了附加政策，允许其在能源管理平台商业性使用GridLoadData，前提是每季度提交数据使用报告并缴纳许可费用。此外，联盟政策明令禁止任何成员或第三方试图识别出单一用户的用电行为。
cu_j_563: 在“工业制造数据空间”中，智能工厂联盟作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含生产设备运行状态和产能统计（匿名聚合）的数据集（FactoryOpsData）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的工业工程院校成员仅限于教学与科研用途，并须在成果发布时注明数据来源。同时，智能工厂联盟为特定的工业自动化软件开发商制定了附加政策，允许其在生产优化平台商业性使用FactoryOpsData，条件是每季度向联盟提交详细使用报告并支付数据许可费。此外，联盟政策严格禁止任何成员或第三方尝试还原设备或工厂的具体身份信息。
cu_j_564: 在“农业食品数据空间”中，省级农产品流通协会作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含农产品流通路径和批量销售数据（匿名聚合）的数据集（AgriFlowData）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的食品安全研究机构仅限非商业性分析使用，且须在研究成果中注明数据来源。同时，省级农产品流通协会为特定的供应链管理平台运营商制定了附加政策，允许其在供应链优化系统中商业性使用AgriFlowData，前提是每季度提交使用报告并按合同支付数据许可费用。此外，联盟政策严禁任何成员或第三方试图还原单一农户或批次的身份信息。
cu_j_565: 在“绿色建筑数据空间”中，城市绿色发展委员会作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含建筑能耗和碳排放（匿名聚合）的数据集（GreenBuildingData）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的环境科学研究机构成员仅限于可持续发展研究使用，并须在成果中注明数据来源。同时，城市绿色发展委员会为特定的建筑节能解决方案供应商制定了附加政策，允许其在节能评估平台商业性使用GreenBuildingData，条件是每季度向委员会提交详细使用报告并支付数据许可费。此外，联盟政策严格禁止任何成员或第三方尝试还原单栋建筑的具体能耗信息。
cu_j_566: 工业互联网数据空间管理方须建立统一的企业资质审核机制，流程包括申请受理、技术能力核查及合规信用评估。申请企业需通过专属门户提交资质材料和应用场景说明，管理方应于3个工作日内完成材料初步审核。技术核查阶段应使用自动化工具评估企业技术方案、网络安全能力及API接口合规性，重点检查是否达到工业信息安全三级标准及数据加密、访问权限等关键要求。信用评估需接入国家企业信用信息公示系统，核查企业经营异常、法律诉讼及行业信用分级，涉外企业还需提供数据跨境合规备案证明。审核通过名单需公示2个工作日无异议后方可接入，整个流程各环节应通过区块链留痕，确保审核全程可追溯且不可篡改。
cu_j_567: 医疗健康数据联盟运营机构应制定统一的成员资质审核规范，审核流程涵盖申请受理、系统安全评估及信用资质核查。申请机构需通过联盟平台提交资质文件及具体数据使用场景描述，运营机构需在7个自然日内完成材料合规性初审。系统安全评估阶段需借助自动化检测平台对机构的技术方案、数据安全措施及接口标准合规性进行检查，重点核实是否满足《电子健康信息安全等级保护》二级及以上标准，特别关注数据脱敏与访问控制能力。信用核查应对接医疗行业信用数据库，核查机构历史违规记录、行政处罚及信用等级，境外机构需补充数据出境合规证明。审核通过名单公示5个自然日无异议后正式纳入联盟，审核全流程应通过区块链技术实现过程存证，确保可追溯性和不可篡改性。
cu_j_568: 能源数据协作空间平台方应建立标准化的参与方资质审核流程，包括申请受理、技术合规性验证和信用风险评估。申请方需通过能源协作门户提交资质证明及业务应用说明，平台方应在2个工作日内完成材料完整性初查。技术合规性验证阶段应依托自动化检测系统，对申请方的技术架构、数据安全能力和接口标准进行评估，重点核查是否符合能源行业安全三级认证及数据加密、访问控制等核心要求。信用风险评估应接入能源行业信用平台，核查历史经营异常、司法纠纷及信用评级，涉外申请方需额外提交数据跨境合规备案。通过名单公示1个工作日无异议后准予接入，所有审核环节均应通过区块链技术留存证据，确保审核过程可溯源、不可篡改。
cu_j_569: 智慧城市数据空间管理机构须制定统一的数据主体准入审核流程，流程包括申请受理、技术能力评估及信用资质核验。申请主体需通过城市数据空间门户提交资质材料与应用场景说明，管理机构应在4个工作日内完成材料初审。技术能力评估阶段应借助自动化检测工具对主体的技术方案、信息安全措施及接口合规性进行评估，重点检查是否符合城市信息安全三级标准及数据加密、访问权限等要求。信用资质核验应对接城市公共信用信息平台，核查主体历史经营异常、司法涉诉及行业信用等级，跨境主体需补充数据出境合规备案材料。审核通过名单需公示2个工作日无异议后方可正式接入，全流程各环节应通过区块链技术存证，保障审核过程的可追溯性和不可篡改性。
cu_j_570: 农业数据共享空间运营方应建立统一的成员资质审核机制，审核流程包括申请受理、技术合规性检测及信用评估。申请成员需通过农业数据平台提交资质证明及业务应用说明，运营方应在6个工作日内完成材料完整性初审。技术合规性检测阶段需依托自动化检测工具对成员的技术方案、数据安全能力及接口标准合规性开展评估，重点核查是否达到农业数据安全三级标准及数据加密、访问控制等核心指标。信用评估环节应接入农业行业信用信息系统，核查成员历史经营异常、司法诉讼及信用评级，涉外成员需额外提供数据跨境合规备案文件。通过名单需公示3个工作日无异议后正式准入，审核全流程各环节应通过区块链技术留存证据，确保审核过程可追溯且不可篡改。
cu_j_571: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，要求“医院联盟”在接入“临床试验结果”时，必须建立包括分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查在内的三重管控体系。分类依据《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》，将数据分为普通、重要和核心三类，并从数据敏感性（如患者隐私、公共健康、行业数据）、应用场景（如科研、医疗服务、政策制定）、风险等级（1-4级）三个维度进行标注。对于3级及以上的数据，需额外进行数据溯源和使用范围条款的审查。质量标准包括数据完整性（≥98%）、字段填充率（≥95%）、时效性（实时数据延迟≤1秒），接入时数据提供方须通过质量检测工具生成评估报告。数据接入审核还必须验证数据采集的合法性和授权的完整性。
cu_j_572: 在“能源数据共享联盟”中，“电网运营商”接入“分布式能源消纳数据”时，必须实施分类分级、质量评估与合规筛查三位一体的管理体系。分类遵循《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》，类别包括常规、关键和核心数据，需从数据敏感性（如个人用电信息、企业能耗、行业统计）、应用场景（如能效分析、市场交易、政策监管）、风险等级（1-4级）三方面进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行数据血缘追溯和用途限制条款的附加审查。质量标准要求数据完整性不低于98%、字段填充率不低于95%、实时数据延迟不超过1秒，数据提供方须提交由质量检测工具生成的评估报告。审核过程中还需重点核查数据采集的合规性与授权情况。
cu_j_573: 在“智慧农业数据空间”中，“农技服务平台”申请接入“遥感作物生长数据”时，必须建立涵盖分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查的综合管控体系。分类依据《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》，分为基础、重要和核心数据，并从数据敏感性（如地块隐私、产量数据、行业信息）、应用场景（如精准种植、农业科研、政策补贴）、风险等级（1-4级）三维度进行标注。3级及以上数据需额外进行数据来源溯源和使用限制条款的审查。质量要求包括数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性（延迟≤1秒），接入时需由数据提供方提交质量检测工具生成的评估报告。审核还需验证数据采集的合法性及授权的完整性。
cu_j_574: 在“金融数据互联平台”中，“商业银行”接入“企业信用评级数据”时，必须执行分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查三重管理机制。分类遵循《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》，数据分为普通、重要、核心三类，并从敏感性（如企业隐私、公共信用、行业数据）、应用场景（如信贷审批、风险控制、监管合规）、风险等级（1-4级）三方面进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行数据血缘追溯和用途限制条款的附加审查。质量标准包括数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时数据延迟≤1秒，数据提供方需通过质量检测工具生成并提交评估报告。数据接入审核还应重点核查数据采集的合法性和授权的完整性。
cu_j_575: 在“智慧城市数据空间”中，“城市管理局”在接入“实时交通流量数据”时，必须建立集分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查于一体的管控体系。分类依据《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》，分为一般、重要、核心三类，并从数据敏感性（如车牌信息、公共出行、行业数据）、应用场景（如交通调度、城市规划、应急管理）、风险等级（1-4级）三维度进行标注。对于3级及以上数据，需额外进行数据血缘追溯和用途限制条款的审查。质量标准为数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性（延迟≤1秒），数据提供方需提交由质量检测工具生成的评估报告。数据接入审核还需重点验证数据采集的合法性及授权的完整性。
cu_j_576: 在“工业互联网数据空间”中，若数据归属不明或合规性存在争议，相关方可提交仲裁。合作协议须指定专属仲裁机构，仲裁流程包括：争议双方需于2个工作日内提交完整的数据授权与处理凭证；仲裁裁决将由区块链智能合约自动执行，如数据被判违规则立即执行链上数据销毁；若争议数据涉及关键基础设施安全，须第一时间上报国家级监管部门并冻结所有相关数据访问权限。
cu_j_577: 在“医疗健康数据联盟”内，针对所有权不明或合规风险的数据，允许通过第三方仲裁解决。联盟协议需明示仲裁机构，仲裁时各方需在5个工作日内提交包括采集同意书和处理日志在内的全部证据；仲裁决定通过智能合约自动落实，若认定数据违规则立即执行数据不可逆删除；如争议数据涉及公共卫生安全，需立刻报告至省级卫健委并暂停相关数据流转。
cu_j_578: 在“能源数据互联平台”中，若数据权属或合规性存在疑问，平台成员可申请仲裁。数据共享协议应明确仲裁机构及流程，争议各方需于1个工作日内提交完整的采集授权及处理记录；仲裁结果由智能合约自动执行，若数据被判违规则触发链上数据销毁流程；涉及国家能源安全的数据争议，须立即上报至国家能源局并临时冻结数据账户。
cu_j_579: 在“智慧城市数据协作区”内，针对归属不明或合规性存疑的数据，允许通过指定仲裁机构裁决。运营协议需规定仲裁流程，争议方须在48小时内提交包括数据采集授权、处理过程证明在内的证据链；仲裁结果将由智能合约自动执行，如认定数据违规则立即执行区块链数据销毁指令；若争议数据涉及城市公共安全，需即时上报市级网信办并冻结相关数据访问。
cu_j_580: 在“金融数据共享联盟”中，若数据归属或合规性产生争议，联盟成员可请求仲裁。联盟协议应明确仲裁机构，争议双方需在2个工作日内提交完整的采集授权和处理记录等证据；仲裁结果通过智能合约自动执行，若判定数据违规则立即执行链上销毁操作；如争议数据涉及金融安全，须立即上报中央金融监管部门并暂停相关账户操作。
cu_j_581: 在“医疗数据互联平台”中，医院联盟需通过标准化API实现电子病历数据的发布、检索与交付全流程。接口要求：数据目录检索接口应支持跨医院联合查询，返回结果需标明数据可用性状态（如“即时获取”或“需伦理审批”）；数据交付接口需兼容HL7 FHIR等主流协议，支持分段加密与动态寻址，确保高敏感健康数据以“可用不可见”方式交付。流程规定：发布阶段，数据提供方须通过加密通道上传数据并生成带有哈希和数字签名的完整性凭证；检索阶段，用户可查询资源，结果自动标注可用性并过滤未授权内容；交付阶段，数据需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过隐私计算平台实现价值释放，严禁明文传输。
cu_j_582: 在“能源数据协作空间”中，电网运营商必须采用统一接口标准完成能耗数据的发布、查询与交付。接口规范：目录查询接口应支持多区域联合检索，返回结果需指明数据可用性（如“直接访问”或“需审批”）；交付接口应兼容MQTT、HTTPS等协议，支持分片加密和动态路由，确保高敏感能耗数据以“可用不可见”模式交付。流程要求：发布时，数据方需通过安全通道上传数据并同步生成哈希和数字签名；查询时，用户可检索数据，结果自动标注可用性并屏蔽未授权内容；交付时，数据必须加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据须通过可信执行环境处理，禁止明文传递。
cu_j_583: 在“金融风控数据空间”中，银行联盟被要求通过标准化接口实现信贷数据的全流程共享。接口要求：数据目录查询接口需支持跨行联合检索，返回结果应包含数据可用性状态（如“可直接调用”或“需合规审批”）；数据交付接口应兼容SFTP、HTTPS等主流协议，支持分片加密与动态寻址，确保高敏感信贷数据采用“可用不可见”模式交付。数据交互流程包括：发布阶段，数据提供方需通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希及数字签名；查询阶段，用户可检索数据，结果自动标注可用性并过滤未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需采用加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过隐私计算框架处理，禁止明文传输。
cu_j_584: 在“智慧农业数据空间”中，农企联盟应通过标准化接口实现作物生长数据的发布、检索与交付。接口规范：目录查询接口需支持跨区域联合检索，返回结果应标明数据可用性（如“可直接获取”或“需授权”）；交付接口应兼容主流物联网协议，支持分片加密和动态寻址，确保高敏感农业数据以“可用不可见”方式交付。流程规定：发布阶段，数据方需通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希和数字签名；检索阶段，用户可检索数据，结果自动标注可用性并过滤未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据须通过可信执行环境或隐私计算平台处理，严禁明文传输。
cu_j_585: 在“智慧城市数据空间”中，城市管理局需通过标准化接口实现城市传感器数据的发布、查询与交付。接口要求：数据目录查询接口应支持多部门联合检索，返回结果应包含数据可用性状态（如“可直接调用”或“需部门审批”）；数据交付接口应兼容RESTful、WebSocket等协议，支持分片加密与动态路由寻址，确保高敏感城市数据采用“可用不可见”模式交付。数据交互流程包括：发布阶段，数据方需通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希值和数字签名；查询阶段，用户可检索空间内资源，结果自动标注可用性并过滤未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需采用加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过可信执行环境或隐私计算框架实现价值释放，禁止明文传输。
cu_j_586: 在“智慧医疗数据联盟”中，要求所有“医疗数据服务商”每12个月接受一次数据安全能力复核，若复核未达标，给予90天整改期，逾期仍不合格者将被移除服务商名单，并对“健康数据产品供应商”实施持续合规检查；对于已接入的“临床试验数据”，每6个月进行一次质量抽检，若不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面复审；当相关医疗数据法规或国家标准发生变更时，应于30个工作日内修订审核标准并通知所有成员，确保其在整改期限内或新规生效前完成合规更新。
cu_j_587: 在“智慧能源数据空间”中，所有“电力设备运维企业”须每12个月接受一次数据安全能力复查，未达标者有90天整改期，整改无效者将被从合格供应商列表中剔除，同时对“能源数据服务提供方”实施动态合规监控；所有已接入的“变电站运行数据”需每6个月进行质量抽检，若抽检不合格率高于5%，则需重新提交全量数据进行审核；如遇能源数据相关法律或国家标准修订，应在30个工作日内更新审核流程并通知全部参与方，确保其在整改期或新规生效前完成合规调整。
cu_j_588: 在“智慧农业数据协作平台”中，所有“农机数据集成商”必须每12个月进行一次数据安全能力复评，未通过者有90天整改期，逾期未合格将被移出平台服务商名单，并对“农产品追溯服务商”实施实时合规检查；所有已接入的“农田遥感影像数据”需每6个月进行质量抽检，若不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面审核；当农业数据相关法律法规或国家标准更新或出台时，应于30个工作日内修订审核政策并通知所有合作方，督促其在整改期或新规生效前完成合规整改。
cu_j_589: 在“智慧物流数据空间”中，所有“第三方物流数据服务商”需每12个月接受一次数据安全能力复审，若未达标，给予90天整改期，逾期仍未合格者将被移除服务商目录，并对“物流信息产品供应商”实施动态合规审查；所有已接入的“运输轨迹数据”每6个月进行一次质量抽检，若抽检不合格率高于5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面复核；当物流数据相关法律法规或行业标准发生调整时，应于30个工作日内更新审核规则并通知所有成员，确保其在整改期限或新规生效前完成合规调整。
cu_j_590: 在“智慧金融数据联盟”中，所有“金融科技服务商”必须每12个月接受一次数据安全能力复核，未通过者有90天整改期，逾期未合格将被移出服务商名单，并对“金融数据产品供应商”实施动态合规检查；所有已接入的“信贷风险评估数据”需每6个月进行质量抽检，若不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面审查；当金融数据相关法律法规或国家标准修订或新发布时，应在30个工作日内更新审核流程并通知所有参与方，确保其在整改期或新规生效前完成合规调整。
cu_j_591: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，要求通过“访问日志存证-零知识证明-异常熔断”机制确保患者数据全生命周期可追溯。日志管理需覆盖数据查询、分析、传输及销毁各环节，涉及敏感字段访问或跨境传输时，必须附加零知识证明并将哈希锚定至联盟链，原始日志保存期不得少于7年。个人健康信息处理应采用同态加密与联邦学习，确保数据可用不可见；统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.2）标准。数据服务商需负责技术合规性验证并向医疗联盟提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超出日均120%，自动分三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全网安全检查。解除熔断需医疗联盟完成原因分析并由服务方重新通过安全认证。
cu_j_592: 在“能源物联网数据联盟”中，要求通过“操作日志存证-零知识验证-异常熔断”机制保障电力设备数据全流程可追溯。日志需涵盖数据采集、处理、传输及销毁，关键操作如高敏感参数访问或数据跨境流动，必须附带零知识证明并经哈希上链，原始日志保存期至少6年。个人用能信息处理应采用同态加密及联邦学习，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.0）标准。数据服务方负责合规性验证并向联盟运营方提交第三方合规报告。若单日异常访问量超出日均130%，自动分三级熔断响应：一级暂停账户，二级隔离资源，三级启动全联盟安全巡检。解除熔断需运营方完成分析报告且服务方重新通过安全认证。
cu_j_593: 在“智慧城市交通数据空间”中，规定必须通过“全链路日志存证-零知识证明-异常熔断”保障交通流量数据全生命周期可追溯。日志应覆盖数据调用、分析、传输及销毁，涉及敏感路段数据访问或数据出境时，需附加零知识证明并将哈希锚定至城市区块链，原始日志保存期不得少于8年。个人出行轨迹处理需采用同态加密与联邦学习，统计数据共享须满足差分隐私（ε≤1.3）要求。数据服务商需负责合规性验证并向城市管理方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均140%，自动触发三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全域安全巡检。解除熔断需管理方完成原因分析且服务方重新通过安全认证。
cu_j_594: 在“工业互联网数据空间”中，要求通过“操作日志存证-零知识验证-异常熔断”机制实现设备运行数据全生命周期可追溯。日志需覆盖数据采集、处理、传输、销毁各环节，关键操作如敏感参数访问或数据跨境传输，必须附加零知识证明并将哈希锚定至联盟链，原始日志保存期不得少于5年。个人工厂数据处理应采用同态加密、联邦学习，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.4）要求。数据服务方负责合规性验证并向工业联盟提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均150%，自动分三级熔断响应：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全网安全巡检。解除熔断需联盟方完成分析报告且服务方重新通过安全认证。
cu_j_595: 在“金融数据协作空间”中，规定必须通过“全流程日志存证-零知识验证-异常熔断”机制保障信贷数据全生命周期可追溯。日志管理应覆盖数据查询、分析、传输及销毁，涉及敏感字段访问或跨境传输时，需附加零知识证明并将哈希锚定至金融区块链，原始日志保存期不得少于10年。个人金融信息处理应采用同态加密、联邦学习，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.1）标准。数据服务商需负责合规性验证并向金融监管方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均125%，自动触发三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全域安全巡检。解除熔断需监管方完成分析报告且服务方重新通过安全认证。
cu_j_596: In the 'Healthcare Research Data Space', only individuals aged 16 or older, or the minimum age of consent in their jurisdiction, are permitted to register and access 'Clinical Trial Results'. Users under 18 must obtain consent from a parent or legal guardian. Registration requires submission of accurate, complete information. Account credentials must not be shared or transferred, and users are responsible for all activities under their account. If registering or accessing data on behalf of an organization, the user must have proper authorization to accept these terms for that entity.
cu_j_597: Within the 'Smart Energy Consortium', participants must be at least 15 years old, or meet the minimum legal age in their region, to access 'Grid Usage Analytics' services. Those below 18 require parental or guardian approval. Accurate and truthful information is mandatory for account creation. Sharing of account credentials or granting access to others is prohibited, and account holders are accountable for all actions performed under their credentials. When acting for another party or company, the registrant must be duly authorized to agree to these terms on their behalf.
cu_j_598: In the 'AgriData Exchange Platform', only users who are at least 14 years old, or the minimum age of consent as per local regulations, may register and access 'Crop Yield Forecast Data'. Users under 18 must secure permission from a parent or legal guardian. Registration demands complete and correct information. Account details must remain confidential and not be disclosed or shared; users bear responsibility for all activities linked to their account. If an account is created or used for another individual or entity, the user must possess the authority to accept these conditions for them.
cu_j_599: The 'Urban Infrastructure Data Space' requires that members be at least 17 years old, or satisfy the minimum age for consent in their country, to register and access 'Public Transit Utilization Data'. Parental or legal guardian consent is mandatory for users under 18. Registration must be completed with accurate and comprehensive details. Account credentials are strictly personal and must not be shared or made accessible to others; the account holder is liable for all account activity. When registering or using the service for another person or organization, appropriate authorization to accept these terms is required.
cu_j_600: On the 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone', access to 'Distributed Manufacturing Schedules' is permitted only to users aged 18 or above, or the minimum age required by applicable law. Users younger than 18 must have explicit parental or guardian consent. Registration necessitates the provision of truthful and complete information. Sharing account credentials or allowing others to use the account is forbidden, and users are responsible for all actions taken with their account. If acting on behalf of another party or entity, the user must be empowered to agree to these terms for them.
cu_j_601: If you believe your proprietary manufacturing data has been misused within the 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone', please submit a formal complaint to the designated compliance office or complete the online incident report. We may restrict or remove datasets that are found or alleged to breach these Data Space Terms, and will suspend access for repeat violators as necessary. Written complaints must include: an authorized representative's signature, a description of the proprietary data in question, the location of the suspected misuse within the platform, your contact details, a statement of good-faith belief that the use is unauthorized, and a declaration of accuracy under penalty of perjury.
cu_j_602: Should you suspect that your trade secrets have been improperly accessed in the 'Healthcare Research Data Space', you must notify the Data Steward at the provided contact address or via the official reporting portal. The Data Space Operator may disable or remove data assets believed to infringe these rules or upon credible allegations, and will revoke credentials of persistent offenders where justified. Reports must contain: a signed statement from an authorized agent, details of the confidential material, a pointer to the data's location, your full contact information, a good-faith assertion of unauthorized use, and a sworn declaration of truthfulness and authority.
cu_j_603: If you identify unauthorized use of your geospatial imagery within the 'Urban Planning Data Exchange', please alert the Data Governance Team at the listed address or through the digital complaint form. Content suspected or alleged to violate these Participation Conditions may be blocked or deleted, and repeat breaches will result in user account termination as appropriate. Submissions must include: a physical or digital signature of your authorized representative, identification of the protected imagery, a reference to where the content appears, your contact information, a statement of good-faith belief of infringement, and a declaration of accuracy and authority under penalty of perjury.
cu_j_604: In the event that your proprietary sensor data is believed to be infringed upon in the 'Industrial IoT Data Space', you are required to submit a notice to the Compliance Desk or use the online infringement notification tool. The Data Space Administrator may remove or restrict access to content suspected or alleged to violate these Participation Policies, and will deactivate accounts of repeat offenders when warranted. Notices must include: an authorized signature, a description of the data asset, the location of the alleged infringement, your address, phone, and email, a good-faith statement regarding unauthorized use, and a certification of accuracy and authority under penalty of perjury.
cu_j_605: If you suspect your clinical trial results have been improperly shared within the 'Pharmaceutical R&D Data Consortium', you should send a detailed notice to the consortium's legal contact or complete the secure reporting form. The consortium may suspend or remove datasets believed or alleged to violate these Terms, and will terminate access for habitual violators as necessary. Written notifications must provide: a signature from an authorized person, a description of the affected clinical data, a reference to its location in the repository, your contact details, a good-faith statement regarding the unauthorized use, and a declaration of accuracy and authority under penalty of perjury.
cu_j_606: To participate in the 'Healthcare Research Data Space', you must register an account. During registration, you are required to provide accurate, current, and complete information and update it as necessary. You are obligated to safeguard your login credentials and shall not share them with any external party. If you detect any unauthorized activity on your account, you must promptly notify the Data Space Operator at: https://www.healthdata.org/report. You acknowledge full responsibility for all actions performed under your account. The Operator reserves the right to suspend your account at any time for non-compliance with these policies, detection of misuse, or violation of applicable regulations. If you wish to terminate your account, contact the Operator at the same link. Upon deletion, your account and all related data will be irreversibly removed.
cu_j_607: Access to the 'Smart Energy Grid Data Exchange' requires creating a user profile. When registering, you shall provide truthful and updated details, maintaining their accuracy at all times. You are responsible for keeping your password confidential and must not share it with others. Should you suspect any unauthorized access, immediately inform the platform administrator at: https://www.energygrid.com/support. You accept sole liability for all activities conducted through your account. The platform may revoke your access if you breach these terms, if illicit or harmful actions are detected, or if legal requirements are not met. To close your account, reach out via the same support link. Account closure is final and all associated records will be permanently deleted.
cu_j_608: Membership in the 'Agri-Food Data Collaboration Platform' is contingent upon account creation. During this process, you must submit accurate, up-to-date, and complete information, and ensure it remains so. You are required to protect your password and are prohibited from disclosing it to any third party. If you notice any suspicious account activity, notify the support team immediately at: https://www.agrifooddata.org/help. You are solely accountable for all operations under your account. The platform reserves the right to deactivate your account for any breach of these guidelines, detection of fraudulent activity, or non-compliance with relevant laws. For account deletion, contact support at the provided link. Once deleted, all account data and content will be permanently erased.
cu_j_609: To utilize the 'Urban Mobility Insights Platform', users must establish an account. When setting up your account, you are obligated to enter precise and current information, updating it as needed. You are solely responsible for maintaining the secrecy of your password and must not reveal it to anyone else. If you suspect your account has been compromised, report it immediately at: https://www.mobilityinsights.com/report. You bear full responsibility for all actions taken via your account. The platform retains the authority to suspend your account if you violate these terms, if any malicious or infringing activity is identified, or if legal standards are breached. To request account deletion, use the same reporting link. Account deletion is irreversible and all associated information will be permanently lost.
cu_j_610: Participation in the 'Federated Manufacturing Data Space' necessitates account registration. During registration, you are required to provide valid, complete, and up-to-date information and keep it accurate. You must keep your password confidential and are forbidden from sharing it with third parties. If you become aware of any unauthorized access, you must notify the administration immediately at: https://www.fedmfgdata.com/contact. You accept sole responsibility for all actions performed under your account. The administrators reserve the right to disable your account for violations of these terms, detection of prohibited activities, or breaches of applicable law. To delete your account, contact administration via the same link. Deletion is permanent and all associated data will be irretrievably removed.
cu_j_611: Accredited academic researchers may retrieve 'Historical Weather Sensor Data' from the Gaia-X Trusted Zone for environmental modeling, with access to the raw datasets limited to 48 hours. During utilization, they are required to acknowledge Gaia-X as the data provider in all published analyses and must not share the original datasets externally. For private meteorological firms wishing to embed the data into commercial forecasting tools, access is available upon payment of a per-terabyte licensing fee.
cu_j_614: Authorized municipal planners may obtain 'Aggregated Traffic Flow Data' from the Urban Data Platform for infrastructure planning, with access to the unprocessed files expiring after 120 hours. During use, planners must attribute the Urban Data Platform in all planning documents and are strictly prohibited from sharing the original files with other organizations. Technology vendors wishing to embed the data into smart city applications can gain access by paying a per-gigabyte usage fee.
cu_j_615: Recognized energy sector analysts are allowed to download 'Renewable Generation Profiles' from the Energy Data Exchange for grid optimization studies, with access to the raw profiles limited to 5 days. While utilizing the profiles, analysts are required to credit the Energy Data Exchange in all published findings and are strictly forbidden from redistributing the original profiles to outside entities. For energy solution providers seeking to integrate the data into proprietary optimization tools, access is available upon payment of a per-site data access fee.
cu_j_617: In the 'HealthDataSpace Consortium', access to 'Hospital Visitor Entry Logs' is allocated based on hospital administrators’ approval for behavioral analytics. Administrators who approve receive immediate, detailed logs; those who do not are provided with delayed, de-identified summaries. Regardless of approval status, the creation or storage of any personal identification profiles from these logs is strictly disallowed for all parties.
cu_j_620: In the 'AgriTech Data Commons', access to 'Livestock Monitoring Feeds' is determined by a farm’s consent to animal health pattern analysis. Farms that consent receive prioritized, real-time video streams; those that do not are granted access to anonymized, batch-processed footage. Irrespective of the farm’s decision, the system is strictly forbidden from generating or storing any biometric or individual animal identification profiles from these feeds.
cu_j_621: Within the Gaia-X Trusted Zone, the energy analytics firm PowerInsights is required to pay a per-query access fee to utilize GridNet's smart meter dataset, GN-Energy-Usage. Its derived metric, PeakLoadScore, can only be accessed through the platform’s approved API, and any bulk export or onward sharing is expressly forbidden. All subscription income from this metric is automatically split after each transaction by a smart contract: GridNet receives 40% as a data royalty, while PowerInsights keeps 60%. Each revenue split is immutably recorded on-chain for audit purposes.
cu_j_622: In the HealthDataSpace, the clinical research platform MedStat Solutions must pay a per-request fee to access BioVault's anonymized patient cohort data, BV-Clinical-Trials. Its resulting analytics product, TrialSuccessRate, is permitted to be queried solely via the platform's validated API, with any batch extraction or external redistribution strictly disallowed. Subscription proceeds from this analytics service are automatically allocated after every transaction by a smart contract: BioVault earns 30% as a data royalty, and MedStat Solutions retains 70%. All distribution events are transparently recorded on the blockchain for compliance.
cu_j_624: Within the AgriData Commons, the agricultural insights firm CropVision must pay a per-API-call fee to access FarmNet’s satellite imagery dataset, FN-Field-Imagery. Its derivative product, YieldForecast, is only accessible through the Commons’ authorized API, with all forms of batch export or redistribution categorically prohibited. Subscription revenue from YieldForecast is automatically apportioned after each transaction by a smart contract: FarmNet receives 50% as a data royalty, and CropVision retains 50%. The revenue allocation is recorded on-chain for traceability.
cu_j_625: In the Smart City Data Exchange, the urban planning analytics provider UrbanSense is required to pay a per-query fee for access to CityInfra’s sensor data set, CI-Traffic-Sensors. Its generated index, CongestionHeatmap, may exclusively be queried via the Exchange’s certified API, with any bulk download or onward redistribution strictly barred. All subscription earnings from this index are automatically divided after each transaction by a smart contract: CityInfra obtains 45% as a data royalty, while UrbanSense keeps 55%. Each transaction and revenue split is logged on-chain for transparency.
cu_j_626: Before accessing the MedDataSpace's Clinical Imaging Archive, BioInsight Analytics must provide a national health data compliance clearance. Prior to any data transfer, the images must be re-anonymized within MedDataSpace's Secure Processing Hub. Usage is strictly limited to algorithm validation inside an accredited Secure Analysis Facility (SAF), and raw images are prohibited from leaving the SAF; only validated algorithm outputs devoid of original data may be exported. Access is restricted to analysts jointly vetted and enrolled by both organizations, with all user actions being streamed live to MedDataSpace's audit system.
